name: Periodista
description: In 1995, Joe McGuirk was tending bar  at Chez Henri, a  bistro in Cambridge, Mass., with an executive chef of Cuban descent. Mr. McGuirk was asked to come up with a menu of Latin-flavored cocktails. He found a rum drink called the periodista (Spanish for “journalist”) in a liquor company's cocktail book and gave it a whirl. Mr. McGuirk did a little tinkering and delivered a cocktail, under the same name, that called for Myer’s rum, apricot brandy, Rose’s lime juice, triple sec and a bit of sugar. The drink took off  and  was soon served across the Boston area. Mr. McGuirk continued to work on the recipe. Here is the one he currently uses.
keywords: apricot liqueur, dark rum, triple sec
recipeIngredient: 1/2 ounce apricot liqueur, preferably Rothman & Winter

recipeInstructions.text: Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker three-quarters filled with ice. Shake until chilled, about 15 seconds. Strain into a chilled coupe.
